reviews.review_msg: Worse prof I have ever had. He teaches you almost nothing. Whatever he teaches you is not even on the exams which are impossible. Class average was a little over 50 on the midterm and he did not scale it. AVOID
Testing was all multiple-choice. Ample opportunity to know the material perfectly but slip up on poorly worded or vague questions.

I took it through distance. The book is important as well as the assignments. I feel more needs to be given in preparation for the final. the avg was alot lower on the final then the rest of the course.

SLOW DOWN....yes, we've heard many times..."don't copy anything you don't understand because you will not read it when you get home." He should at least let us process the information first. He's speeding through the material.

Tough class, especially if unable to teach yourself concepts.  Open book midterm and final make things easier, but there is a catch.  The midterm and first few assignments are really easy, but the assignments after the midterm are marked very hard, and the final was ridiculous.  Hardly any of here questions were ones we had even previously. AVOID!

When it comes to learning the material, rely on your textbook and not her. Open book midterm/final. I had a tough time sitting through her lectures, which are completely useless anyways. Slides are missing crucial information and she is constantly correcting mistakes. Would never recommend this prof to anyone, especially if stats isn't your forte.

Open book midterm/final. Fairly nice prof, just a little hard to understand. The comment below saying those comments were from closed minded individuals is not necessarily true. The prof did refuse to explain a concept she had discussed 'previously (from last lecture)'. And it is true that you will probably learn more from the book than her.

She's very nice and cute person but her accent is a little hard for me to understand. It was hard to keep up with what she was trying to explain. I ended up reading the textbook instead of listening to her. The midterm was open book though, so that's a plus!
Not good at explaining the concepts, most of the slides are filled with useless information. No enjoyment at all throughout this class.
